reviews.text: We can down to do some shopping and booked here. Great value, rooms clean and breakfast that was included was impressive. Lots of choices! Will stay here again and reccomend it to everyone we know coming there
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.text: I was traveling on fed gov't business. Some of the hotels in town wouldn't honor the GSA rate on the weekend. The manager at the Comfort Inn did. My room was well appointed and clean. They also had a nice indoor pool, jacuzzi, ample fitness center, and a great free breakfast. The breakfast was like what you get at a Holiday Inn Express-the full spread. I think this hotel should be higher up on the list of top hotels in Wenatchee.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, good value

reviews.text: So I booked a non smoking room, weeks in advance. But when I got there, there was one room left in the whole hotel, and it is a smoking room. AND IT STINKS! And because there's a convention in town, which is why I'm here, all the other hotel rooms are full. So I'm stuck here. The guy at the front desk was nice, when he explained "I'm sorry sir, it happens all the time!" ALL THE TIME! AND IT STINKS! So much for booking a non smoking room weeks in advance...
reviews.title: No Smoking Nightmare

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 2 nights, while helping a relative move. The property is in an excellent location, and very well maintained. The room was clean and well appointed. We did not actually use the pool area, but it looked very inviting. General Manager Sara Baum was cheerful and helpful, and other front desk people were efficient and friendly as well. I always search aggressively online for the best lodging for the money, and am finding it increasingly difficult to find anything decent for much under $100. The included breakfast was good, cold things cold, hot things hot. I booked this property through an online agency; the rack rate was an excellent value, compared to other nearby motels. I recommend this place.
reviews.title: Sara Baum rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were so many good things about this hotel. It was newer and very nicely decorated. The breakfast buffet was very good, no need to eat out when you stay here! The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. The room had a screen between the bed and sitting area which was nice for us because my husband likes to go to sleep earlier than I do and I stayed up and read without bothering him. But the tv was across from the bed so if I had wanted to watch tv while he slept that wouldn't have worked. Now for the cons. One of the main things you go a hotel for is to sleep. The fan on the air/heat was the loudest I've ever heard. It was right next to the bed and blew ice cold air over you. I got up 4 times to change the setting as we were both freezing. The second night we bought a fan at the Big Lots close by and slept much better. That is until the people in the room above us got up early in the morning and it sounded like they were stomping as hard as they could. We literally had things vibrating in our room from their footsteps. This went on for 45 minutes and we were wide awake by that point. I don't know if they didn't put enough sound insulating material between floors or we had exceptionally large people above us. I noticed while in the bathroom that you could hear very clearly what what going on in the bathroom above also (yuck). So as much as this hotel had some great things going for it, I'm afraid I can't rate it any higher.
reviews.title: I really wanted to give this hotel a higher rating...

reviews.text: I have had the opportunity to stay here on more than one occasion. Both for pleasure and business. The accomodations are very nice, the rooms are beautifully decorated, the beds are comfortable, there is a hot breakfast and above all else the staff are wonderful. They are very accomodating, courteous, attentive, and caring.
reviews.title: It's a gem and so are the people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again and tell others about it.
reviews.title: Pretty average

reviews.text: Nice exterior and lobby area. Easy and speedy check in. Decent size room, although layout was a bit odd. Our king room was big, the tv was centered in the room, but the bed was off center and it just looked and felt weird. The bathroom design is horrible, but was definitely usable. Beds were very firm and comfy, pillows were not. The room and hotel were clean overall. Breakfast was the usual fare and very busy. The pool and hot tub looked nice, although we did not use them. There were train tracks outside, but we never heard a train. We did hear a lot of children running in the hall and in and out of rooms near our room. Average value for the price paid.
reviews.title: A helping hand in time of need

reviews.text: My son, husband and I were evacuated in the Wenatchee fires. Comfort Inn welcomed us in Wednesday night when we had no place to go. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was exceptional. At a time when stress level could have been high I felt calm and relaxed thanks to the exceptional staff at Comfort Inn. They did all this without asking for a single dime. THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH TO THE STAFF AT COMFORT INN IN WENATCHEE.
reviews.title: Will stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on September 18, 2012. We were going to spend 3 nights and use this as our base for seeing sights in the area including the boat trip to Stehekin on Lake Chelan. The rate we received was very good. On our trip up to and our arrival in Wenachee we drove through smoke from several wildfires that was so thick that visibility at times was less than 1/4 mile. We had to stay in our room the entire afternoon and evening except to go out and eat. We heard conditions in Lake Chelan were pretty much the same and not expected to change. We decided we'd go back home the next day. I went to the front desk to let them know we wouldn't be staying the other 2 nights, and expected to hear that they would charge us for the rooms anyway. Well to my surprise the gal was really nice, said she understood and we weren't obligated to pay for the remaining reserved nights.
reviews.title: Love the special Sunday night rate through TripAdvisor!

reviews.text: My wife, puppy and I stayed here for the Apple Blossom weekend. It was one of the few that would accept pets and we were a little apprehensive. Even though it is a slightly older facility we were surprised at the overall cleanliness. Breakfast was bordering on totally impressive for free. Overall a very pleasant stay for the price. Thank you to Sara for all your help in booking our room.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: My wife and I had to stay in Wenatchee for one night on short notice. We took a chance on the Comfort Inn and I was very impressed with everything. The facility and room were very clean. Everything worked as expected and the breakfast was varied and high quality - I had cereal, a waffle, eggs, biscuits and gravy and orange juice. They also had sausage, pastries, fruit, coffee, milk and probably other items I didn't even see - what an incredible selection. I noticed an indoor pool and hot tub, but didn't use them. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. What a great experience.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently we enjoyed a two night stay at the Comfort Inn Suites in Wenatchee, WA. The quality of the room, bed and morning breakfast for the price was exceeded. The room was spacious and clean. We'll definitely be back to stay here.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: We stayed here for a basketball tournament and paid only $79/night. I was expecting a dive and was pleasantly surprised to find a spacious, clean room with decent, comfortable beds! The room included a good-sized fridge and microwave and room for a roll away or crib, if needed. The pool was tiny but available until 10. The breakfast was a decent waffle, yogurt fare, but included eggs and sausage and a really large seating area--with overflow. All in all I was very pleased--absolutely nothing to complain about. Oh, and because they probably get lots of kids sports teams, they have you sign a "behavior" agreement that you will keep kids from running and screaming all day and night--under the threat if being asked to leave. This must've worked because it was quiet here despite having lots of girls basketball teams.
reviews.title: Rooms and hotel were way better than expected for the price paid!

reviews.text: Generally it was a pleasant stay but the hotel needs better maintenance, especially the pool area. Our room was clean and everything in the room including the A/C (very quiet) worked well. But the corridors and stairs were not so clean. The vending machine was out of order. Since there is no shower booth in the pool area. Kids were running the filthy corridors and then jumping right into the pool and the spa. And the pool uses excessive chlorine which fills the entire pool and the lobby area with its odor. There were only a small number of towels in the pool so kids were running back to their room dripping water all over the corridors and stairs. It is basically because the hotel is understaffed. It took quite a while to get checked-in because there was only one receptionist who was taking care of all the check-in guests as well as running errands at the same time. If you are planning a family trip to Wenatchee, I would suggest you to go for Comfort Suites, which is a newer and much cleaner establishment.
reviews.title: Needs some maintenance and more staffing

reviews.text: Stay was friendly and helpful, very informative to surrounding areas and resturants, Clean facilty and definately great stay for the price and area location. eating very close by with surrounding eating spots
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: This property was a bit disappointing. More staff was needed at check in as the one staff member (who was very nice) at the desk was overwhelmed answering phones and trying to help us check in. Room ( a "suite") was very clean but also very dated. Bathroom was way too tiny. Could not make phone calls out and wifi connection was really spotty. One (slow) elevator made it difficult to get in & out of the building. Breakfast was somewhat discusting and needed more staff to keep things cleaner. Having said all of this, the pool & hot tub were really clean and we loved that this area was open 24 hours for adults. Also the hotel manager was excellent; very friendly & professional and did the right thing by adjusting our bill to compensate for our lack of internet/ phone. Overall, an ok stay but for the money stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the better Comfort Inns. Have stayed here more than once and will again. Staff is Top Notch! Very friendly, courteous and helpful. Rates are very good for quality of stay. Good location, easy to reach and good parking.
reviews.title: Will return.

reviews.text: Art W. (AXW6129)
reviews.title: Our Stay

reviews.text: We have stayed at Comfort Inns on our trip to Arizona and this hotel was at the top of the list with respect to service. There is a wide disparity in service between these hotels but this Comfort Inn was better than most.
reviews.title: Very clean. Better than adequate.
